title: The Medieval Islamic Civilization - C. 12 (Thought, Philosophy3)
description:
The Medieval Islamic Civilization - Collection 12 (Thought, Philosophy 3):

We have 27 titles here:

-  Adamson - Al-Kindi (2007)

-  Bladel - The Arabic Hermes; from Pagan Sage to Prophet of Science (2009)

-  Calverley & Pollock (Trans. & Eds.) - Nature, Man and God in Medieval Islam; al-Bydawi's Text Tawali' al-Anwar min Matali' al-Anzar (2002)

-  Crone - Roman, Provincial and Islamic Law; The Origins of the Islamic Patronate (1987)

-  Fakhry - Islamic Philosophy, Theology and Mysticism; a Short Introduction (1997)

-  Ghazanfar (Ed.) - Medieval Islamic Economic Thought; Filling the Great Gap in European Economics (2003)

-  Goldziher - Introduction to Islamic Theology and Law (1981)

-  Hammond - The Philosophy of Alfarabi and Its Influence on Medieval Thought (1947)

-  Hughes - The Texture of the Divine; Imagination in Medieval Islamic and Jewish Thought (2004)

-  Inglis (Ed.) - Medieval Philosophy and the Classical Tradition; In Islam, Judaism and Christianity (2002)

-  Jamil ur Rehman - The Philosophy and Theology of Averroes (1921)

-  Kahl - The Dispensatory of Ibn at-Tilmid; Arabic Text, English Translation, Study, and Glossaries (2007)

-  Koenig & Al-Shohaib - Health and Well-Being in Islamic Societies; Background, Research, and Applications (2014)

-  Leonard - Islam; Her Moral and Spiritual Values (1909)

-  McGregor -  Sanctity and Mysticism in Medieval Egypt, The Wafa Sufi Order and the Legacy of Ibn 'Arabi (2004)

-  Milchert - Ahmad ibn Hanbal (2006)

-  Mirakhor & Askari - Islam and the Path to Human and Economic Development (2010)

-  Netton - Al-Farabi and His School (1992)

-  Sachedina - Islamic Biomedical Ethics; Principles and Application (2009)

-  Sayeed - Women and the Transmission of Religious Knowledge in Islam (2013)

-  Shuraydi - The Raven and the Falcon; Youth versus Old Age in the Medieval Arabic Literature (2014)

-  Steenbergen - Order Out of Chaos; Patronage, Conflict and Mamluk Socio-Political Culture, 1341-1382 (2006)

-  Stiles - An Islamic Court in Context; an Ethnographic Study of Judicial Reasoning (2009)

-  Swain (Ed.) - Seeing the Face, Seeing the Soul; Polemon's Physignomy from Classical Antiquity to Medieval Islam (2007)

-  van Berkel et al - Crisis and Continuity at the Abbasid Court; Formal and Informal Politics in the Caliphate of al-Muqtadir, .. (2013)

-  Weiss - The Search for God's Law; Islamic Jurisprudence in the Writing of Sayf al-Din al-Amidi, rev. ed. (2010)

-  Yazaki - Islamic Mysticism and Abu Talib al-Makki; the Role of the Heart (2013)
